name: A'arif Fort
description: A historic mud-brick fortress perched on a hilltop, offering panoramic views of Hail city.

name: Jubbah Rock Carvings
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site featuring ancient petroglyphs and inscriptions on sandstone formations.

name: Yanbu Al-Bahr (Old Town)
description: The historic heart of Yanbu, with restored traditional Hijazi buildings and a bustling souq.

name: Royal Commission Beach
description: A pristine and well-maintained public beach known for its clear waters and family-friendly facilities.

name: Rijal Almaa Heritage Village
description: A unique village in the Asir region with distinctive tall stone fortresses, now a museum.

name: King Abdulaziz Center for World Culture (Ithra)
description: A modern architectural marvel housing a museum, library, cinema, and theater.

name: Al Ahsa Oasis
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site and the largest palm oasis in the world, with springs and canals.

name: Fayfa Mountains
description: Steep, terraced mountains known as the 'Neighbor of the Moon' for their high altitude and green landscapes.

name: Wadi Lajab
description: A stunning canyon with a freshwater stream running through it, often called the 'paradise in the desert'.

name: Umluj Beach
description: Often called the 'Maldives of Saudi Arabia' for its white sandy beaches and clear turquoise waters.

name: Jabal al-Lawz
description: The 'Mountain of Almonds', one of the tallest peaks in Saudi Arabia, known to get snowfall in winter.

name: Maghaer Shuaib (Caves of Jethro)
description: An ancient archaeological site near Al-Bada' with Nabatean tombs carved into sandstone.

name: Boulevard City
description: A permanent, large-scale entertainment zone with global experiences, restaurants, and events.

name: Riyadh Zoo
description: A large zoo housing over 1,500 animals from around the world in a spacious park setting.

name: Hima Cultural Area
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site with a vast collection of rock art and inscriptions dating back 7,000 years.

name: Amarah Palace (Najran Fort)
description: A historic mud-brick palace in the center of Najran, now a museum showcasing the region's history.

name: Red Sea Mall
description: One of Jeddah's largest malls, featuring a wide range of international brands, a cinema, and a large food court.

name: Mall of Arabia
description: A popular shopping destination with a unique design, extensive retail options, and family entertainment.

name: Boulevard World
description: A seasonal entertainment zone (part of Riyadh Season) with pavilions representing different countries.

name: Al-Muftaha Historical Village
description: A cultural center in Abha with traditional buildings, art galleries, and craft shops.

name: Haql Shipwreck Beach
description: A scenic beach on the Gulf of Aqaba, famous for the half-submerged wreckage of a cargo ship.

name: Al Soudah Park
description: Located in Saudi Arabia's highest mountains, offering cool weather, dense juniper forests, and cable car rides.

name: Yanbu Lake Park
description: A beautiful public park with a large artificial lake, green lawns, and children's play areas.

name: Hisma Desert
description: A stunning desert region with dramatic red sandstone formations, often compared to Wadi Rum.

name: Al Qarah Mountain
description: A unique limestone hill with a network of caves and canyons, offering guided tours and cool air.
